# Interactive component

```{r}
library(plotly)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(stringr)

load("./data/RData/data_MMASH_results.RData")

temp = difference %>% tidyr::spread(key = Chemicals, value = difference)
temp['user'] = lapply(temp['user'] , function(x)as.numeric(str_remove(x, "user_")))

df_plot = sleep_data %>% 
  select( M, In.Bed.Time, Out.Bed.Time) %>% 
  mutate(user = sapply(rownames(sleep_data),simplify =TRUE, function(x)as.numeric(stringr::str_remove(x, "user_")))) %>% 
  left_join(temp, by = 'user')

avg_saliva = saliva %>% group_by(user) %>% summarise(avg.Cortisol = mean(Cortisol.NORM), avg.Melatonin = mean(Melatonin.NORM))
avg_saliva['user'] = lapply(avg_saliva['user'] , function(x)as.numeric(str_remove(x, "user_")))

temp = df_plot['user']

df_plot = df_plot %>% 
  left_join(avg_saliva, by = 'user')

df_plot['user'] = temp
readr::write_csv(df_plot,"./data/interactive_plot.csv")
```


<meta charset="utf-8">
          
<!-- Load d3.js -->
<script src="https://d3js.org/d3.v6.js"></script>

<!-- Add 2 buttons -->
<button onclick="update('M')">Sleep Quality (M)</button>
<button onclick="update('avg.Cortisol')">avg.Cortisol</button>
<button onclick="update('avg.Melatonin')">avg.Melatonin</button>
<button onclick="update('Cortisol.NORM')">diff.Cortisol</button>
<button onclick="update('Melatonin.NORM')">diff.Melatonin</button>

<!-- Create a div where the graph will take place -->
<div id="my_dataviz"></div>


<script>

// set the dimensions and margins of the graph
const margin = {top: 30, right: 30, bottom: 70, left: 60},
    width = 460 - margin.left - margin.right,
    height = 400 - margin.top - margin.bottom;

// append the svg object to the body of the page
const svg = d3.select("#my_dataviz")
  .append("svg")
    .attr("width", width + margin.left + margin.right)
    .attr("height", height + margin.top + margin.bottom)
  .append("g")
    .attr("transform", `translate(${margin.left},${margin.top})`);

// Initialize the X axis
const x = d3.scaleBand()
  .range([ 0, width ])
  .padding(0.2);
const xAxis = svg.append("g")
  .attr("transform", `translate(0,${height})`);

// Initialize the Y axis
const y = d3.scaleLinear()
  .range([ height, 0]);
const yAxis = svg.append("g")
  .attr("class", "myYaxis");


// A function that create / update the plot for a given variable:
function update(selectedVar) {

  // Parse the Data
  d3.csv("/data/interactive_plot.csv").then( function(data) {

    // X axis
    x.domain(data.map(d => d.user));
    xAxis.transition().duration(1000).call(d3.axisBottom(x));

    // Add Y axis
    y.domain([0, d3.max(data, d => +d[selectedVar]) ]);
    yAxis.transition().duration(1000).call(d3.axisLeft(y));

    // variable u: map data to existing bars
    const u = svg.selectAll("rect")
      .data(data)

    // update bars
    u.join("rect")
      .transition()
      .duration(1000)
        .attr("x", d => x(d.user))
        .attr("y", d => y(d[selectedVar]))
        .attr("width", x.bandwidth())
        .attr("height", d => height - y(d[selectedVar]))
        .attr("fill", "#69b3a2")
  })

}

// Initialize plot
update('M')

</script>
